stories.text:
I am currently falling out of love with university. I managed to get into the best university in my region with the hope of learning, meeting interesting people, and working on things that matter.

I am frustrated with the way things have turned out. The things I do in college don't excite me and people are extremely close minded. University currently feels like a waste of time. I enjoy my time working on side coding projects a lot more. University just seems to get in the way of the learning I truly care about and the tasks that I consider important.

I'm curious to hear about dropout stories here, since there seems to be a lot of survivorship bias from people online.

I want to hear all about it. Good and bad.
stories.title: Ask HN: What is your college dropout story / roadmap?

stories.text:
Is there a public Slack or Discord for asking questions about common developer tools e.g. programming language, build tools, troubleshooting etc. ?

We have a few of these at work but almost none of the discussion is specific to our company and could easily be happening in public.

Seems a shame to be having all these conversations in private unnecessarily, when we could all be benefiting from shared knowledge.
stories.title: Ask HN: public Slack/Discord for developer tooling?
